intro: Limonium ugijarense, commonly known as the Canary Islands sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces clusters of small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. Limonium ugijarense is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and attractive floral display.
